comments: Arises in the approximation of 14-fold quasipatterns by 14 Fourier modes.
references: A. M. Rucklidge & W. J. Rucklidge (preprint) 2002.
links: Harry J. Smith, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..20000
S. Lang and H. Trotter, Continued fractions for some algebraic numbers, J. Reine Angew. Math. 255 (1972), 112-134.
Index entries for continued fractions for constants
formula: w satisfies w^3 - w^2 - 2w + 1 = 0 and so is algebraic.
prog: (PARI) { allocatemem(932245000); default(realprecision, 21000); x=contfrac(2*cos(Pi/7)); for (n=0, 20000, write("b039921.txt", n, " ", x[n+1])); } \\ _Harry J. Smith_, May 31 2009
crossrefs: Cf. A160389 Decimal expansion. - _Harry J. Smith_, May 31 2009
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
